title: Why 5 PS Editors Are Obsessed With This Silky-Smooth Pajama Set
description: PS editors take sleep very seriously - we've tested TikTok sleep hacks, made sleepy-girl mocktails, and rounded up the best products for better sleep. So it's probably no surprise that we scour the internet for the best sleepwear styles, too. There's nothing as satisfying as putting on a fresh set of comfy PJs to lounge around or snooze in, but it's even better when they look as good as they feel. When our editors came across Neendi's pajama sets, we jumped at the chance to try them. The long sleeve button-down top and matching pants have a "relaxed fit" and are made from the brand's signature Norma fabric that's soft but durable. And because the silky-smooth fabric is made of rayon and viscose, you can feel good about throwing them in the wash (unlike most silk pajamas). But the best thing about Neendi's sets is that there's no need to sacrifice style for comfort. The eye-catching designs the pajamas come in - think vintage birthday cakes, groovy daisies, or bright pink takeout boxes - are unique compared to other options we've seen on the market. But are these the PJs of our dreams? We break down our experiences wearing, sleeping in, and even washing Neendi's pajama sets ahead. Keep reading for five editors' honest reviews - and to see all the fun patterns that struck our fancy.
author: Alida Araica
excerpt: PS editors share their honest thoughts on Neendi’s pajama sets in their signature Norma fabric. Read ahead for our thoughts on the fit, designs, and price.

PS editors take sleep very seriously — we've tested TikTok sleep hacks, made sleepy-girl mocktails, and rounded up the best products for better sleep. So it's probably no surprise that we scour the internet for the best sleepwear styles, too. There's nothing as satisfying as putting on a fresh set of comfy PJs to lounge around or snooze in, but it's even better when they look as good as they feel.

When our editors came across Neendi's pajama sets, we jumped at the chance to try them. The long sleeve button-down top and matching pants have a "relaxed fit" and are made from the brand's signature Norma fabric that's soft but durable. And because the silky-smooth fabric is made of rayon and viscose, you can feel good about throwing them in the wash (unlike most silk pajamas). But the best thing about Neendi's sets is that there's no need to sacrifice style for comfort. The eye-catching designs the pajamas come in — think vintage birthday cakes, groovy daisies, or bright pink takeout boxes — are unique compared to other options we've seen on the market.

But are these the PJs of our dreams? We break down our experiences wearing, sleeping in, and even washing Neendi's pajama sets ahead. Keep reading for five editors' honest reviews — and to see all the fun patterns that struck our fancy.

Neendi Takeout Long Pajama Set

Neendi Takeout Long Pajama Set ($128)

"It might sound silly, but a matching pajama set is part of my formula for a good night's sleep. Since converting from classic old T-shirts and sweats a few years ago, I've built a solid collection of coordinated sleep sets, but none are as fun as this pair from Neendi. Design wise, the takeout motifs and color combo are adorably fun. But more importantly, the pajamas' Norma fabric is silky and comfortable as promised, but also has a cooling, breathable touch that's great for hot sleepers. I also appreciate the subtle, flattering design touches like the deep V neckline and the split hem on the pants. I do love the feeling of putting on pajamas fresh out of the dryer, so I was a little disappointed to learn these are meant to hang-dry only, but the small inconvenience is worth it." — Yerin Kim, features editor

Rating:
★★★★★

Neendi Abstract Daisy Long Pajama Set

Neendi Abstract Daisy Long Pajama Set ($128)

"A few years ago, I cleared my pajama collection of the miscellaneous high school sports T-shirts I'd been hoarding in favor of matching sets. I felt the swap would help me look (and feel) more put together. Now that my sleepwear collection is stocked with matching button-ups and pants, I can't imagine wearing anything else to bed. The Neendi Abstract Daisy Long Pajama Set is the latest addition to my lineup, and after one wear, I'm obsessed. The yellow flower print is fun and trendy, and the material is soft to the touch and super breathable. While some PJ sets can look frumpy, this one looks effortlessly cool and elevated. I love them." — Jessica Harrington, senior beauty editor

Rating:
★★★★★

Neendi Vintage Buttercream Cake Long Pajama Set

Neendi Vintage Buttercream Cake Long Pajama Set ($128)

"Thanks to a fire alarm, I've had to evacuate a hotel in my pajamas before. As it turns out, I would not wear my oldest college tee out in public if given the choice. Since that day, I've been slowly adding new PJs to my wardrobe that I wouldn't mind being seen in outside. But none have been quite as cute or as soft as Neendi's Vintage Buttercream Cake Long Pajama Set.

"I toss and turn in my sleep, so I was happy that the button-front long-sleeve top had a looser fit and the pant legs had a split hem that allowed for more movement and limited the amount of times I get tangled in my sheets. They're also made of a very breathable fabric, which means I never found myself overheating or sweating under my comforter and fleece blanket. Finally, I can't go without saying how obsessed I am with the set's vintage cake design (and the brand's fun prints overall). These are without a doubt the cool-girl pajamas in my wardrobe." — Alida Araica, newsletter manager

Rating:
★★★★★

Neendi Abstract Daisy Long Pajama Set

Neendi Abstract Daisy Long Pajama Set ($128)

"When it comes to pajamas, I typically sleep in the biggest, softest T-shirt I can find and a pair of boy shorts. But this Neendi set completely changed that — and it's not just because it's too adorable to take off. I usually find that satin material can be hot to sleep in, but the brand's signature Norma fabric definitely doesn't cause overheating. Instead, it's ridiculously soft against the skin and almost cooling.

"I will say that after a couple of washes, the silk felt less cool to the touch and more lived-in, but the material didn't pill — it just lost a touch of luster. The set did shrink just a bit, but the brand cautions this in the description, so you should size up if you're in-between sizes. I went with my usual size (XS) and it fit me perfectly, even after washing. I was pleasantly surprised the pants weren't too long, especially since I'm petite (5'1") and most pajama bottoms tend to drag on the floor. Overall, I'm very impressed with this set and love the print so much, I might just repurpose the top as a blouse underneath a blazer." — Sarah Wasilak, associate shopping content director

Rating:
★★★★☆

Neendi Breakfast Long Pajama Set

Neendi Breakfast Long Pajama Set ($128)

"When I say luxury this is what I mean! Neendi's PJ's made me want to upgrade my current selection that consists mostly of sweatshirts/T-shirts and shorts and I'm absolutely here for it. The pink fabric is adorned with playful breakfast items all over them like donuts, waffles, and croissants. And can we talk about how soft it feels and breathable?! To be honest, I can see myself wearing them all year round. It's also a woman-owned company, and that makes me love them even more.

"P.S. I have my eye on the takeout, checkered swirl, and vintage buttercream pajamas, too!" — Shari Straker, social content producer

Rating:
★★★★★
